newsitem.title: USA: Harmony Products, Cypress Chem to merge.
newsitem.headline: Harmony Products, Cypress Chem to merge.

text.p: Cypress Chemical Co and Harmony Products Inc said Friday they would merge under a plan that would give Cypress an 85 percent controlling interest in Harmony.
Cypress will acquire all of the outstanding shares of Harmony in exchange for a combination of Cypress common and preferred shares, the companies said.
The Cypress shares would be subject to redemption after two years at Cypress's option for about $3.45 million.
The preferred shares would be convertible into Cypress common shares on a one-for-one basis.
The deal is expected to be closed by December 31, the companies said.
Cypress manufactures and sells synthetic fertilizers. Harmony, which discontinued operating its primary production line last year, also is involved in the speciality fertilizer market.
